title: [K-12] Analyzing e-Learning Impact in Engineering Education: Blended Mathematics Curriculum Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering mathematics (calculus, linear algebra) and experience with online learning tools (basic LMS usage)
context.additional_context: In environments where digital devices (tablets/laptops) are provided, learners participate in blended classes combining theory and practice. Targeting groups with e-learning experience post-COVID-19 but high interest in returning to in-person classes

learning_goals: Learners apply mathematical concepts required for engineering problem-solving with over 80% accuracy using e-learning tools (e-learning platforms, digital simulations).
Learners comparatively analyze the strengths and weaknesses of e-learning and face-to-face instruction in blended learning environments and develop strategies aligned with their learning styles.
Learners can measure the effectiveness of skill acquisition in the e-learning process through formative assessments and evaluate the applicability to future engineering education.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
